title: “authorised person” means a person appointed in accordance with Regulation
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Communities (Birds
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Communities (Birds 

Declarations) Regulations 2023. 

Interpretation
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited european community (birds declarations) regulation 2023 interpretation

title: “authorised person” means a person appointed in accordance with Regulation
heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations—
text_raw:
2. (1) In these Regulations— 

“authorised person” means a person appointed in accordance with Regulation 
5(1) or (2); 

“Directive” means Directive 2009/147/EC of the European Parliament and of 
the Council of 30 November 20091 on the conservation of wild birds, as 
amended by Council Directive 2013/17/EU of 13 May 20132 adapting certain 
directives in the field of environment, by reason of the accession of the 
Republic of Croatia; 

“Minister” means the Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage; 

“Regulations of 1986” means the European Communities (Wildlife Act 1976) 
(Amendment) Regulations 1986 (S.I. No 254 of 1986). 

(2) A word or expression that is used in these Regulations and also used in 
the Directive has, unless the contrary intention appears, the same meaning in 
these Regulations as in the Directive. 

Derogations
text_norm: 2 (1) regulations-- authorised person mean person appointed accordance regulation 5(1) (2) directive mean directive 2009 147 ec european parliament council 30 november 20091 conservation wild bird amended council directive 2013 17 eu 13 may 20132 adapting certain directive field environment reason accession republic croatia minister mean minister housing local government heritage regulation 1986 mean european community (wildlife act 1976) (amendment) regulation 1986 (s.i 254 1986) (2) word expression used regulation also used directive unless contrary intention appears meaning regulation directive derogation

title: “authorised person” means a person appointed in accordance with Regulation
heading: 3. (1) Notwithstanding the provisions of the Wildlife Act 1976 (No. 39 of
text_raw:
3. (1) Notwithstanding the provisions of the Wildlife Act 1976 (No. 39 of 
1976), the Minister may, following consultation with such other Minister, or 
Ministers, of Government having relevant responsibilities or functions as the 
Minister considers appropriate, derogate, by declaration, from any of the 
obligations of the State under Articles 5, 6, 7 and 8 of the Directive, in respect 
of any species of bird listed in Schedule 1, where there is no other satisfactory 
solution, for one, or more, of the following reasons: 

(a) 

(i) 

in the interests of public health and safety, 

1 OJ No. L 20, 26.01.2010, p. 7. 
2 OJ No. L 158, 10.06.2013, p. 193. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 28th November, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [576] 3 

(ii) 

in the interests of air safety, 

(iii) 

to prevent serious damage to crops, livestock, forests, 
fisheries and water, or 

(iv) 

for the protection of flora and fauna; 

(b) 

(c) 

for the purposes of research and teaching, of re-population, of 
re-introduction and for the breeding necessary for these 
purposes; 

to permit, under strictly supervised conditions and on a selective 
basis, the capture, keeping or other judicious use of certain birds 
in small numbers. 

(2) Declarations made under paragraph (1) shall specify the following: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

the species of bird which is subject to the derogation; 

the means, arrangements or methods, listed in Schedule 2, 
authorised for capture or killing of the species of bird 
concerned; 

the conditions of risk and the circumstances of time and place 
under which such derogations are granted; 

the authority empowered to declare that the required conditions 
obtain and to decide what means, arrangements or methods of 
capture or killing may be used, within what limits and by whom; 

(e) 

the controls which shall be carried out. 

Annual report to European Commission

title: “authorised person” means a person appointed in accordance with Regulation
heading: 4. The Minister shall forward to the European Commission, in respect of
text_raw:
4. The Minister shall forward to the European Commission, in respect of 

each year, a report on the implementation of derogations under Regulation 3. 

Authorised persons
text_norm: 4 minister shall forward european commission respect year report implementation derogation regulation 3 authorised person

title: “authorised person” means a person appointed in accordance with Regulation
heading: 5. (1) The Minister may appoint in writing a person to be an authorised
text_raw:
5. (1) The Minister may appoint in writing a person to be an authorised 

person for the purposes of these Regulations. 

(2) The appointment of an authorised person pursuant to Regulation 5(1) of 
the Regulations of 1986 that was in force immediately prior to the coming into 
operation of these Regulations is deemed to be an appointment under this 
Regulation. 

(3) An authorised person shall be furnished with a certificate of their 
appointment as an authorised person and when exercising any power conferred 
on an authorised person by these Regulations shall, if requested by any person 
affected, produce the certificate to such person. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [576] 

Powers of authorised persons

title: “authorised person” means a person appointed in accordance with Regulation
heading: 6. An authorised person may, for the purposes of these Regulations—
text_raw:
6. An authorised person may, for the purposes of these Regulations— 

(a) 

(b) 

enter on and inspect any lands on which they reasonably believe 
that killing or capturing of wild birds has taken place, or 

request the owner or occupier of any lands on which they 
reasonably believe that killing or capturing of wild birds has 
taken place to provide him or her with information about— 

(i) 

(ii) 

the number, if any, of wild birds killed or captured on such 
lands, 

the means by which such wild birds have been killed or 
captured, or 

(iii) any poisons which may have been laid to kill wild birds 
including, but without prejudice to the generality of the 
aforesaid, 
the quantity, type and 
information about 
frequency of laying of poisons. 

Enforcement
text_norm: 6 authorised person may purpose regulations-- (a) (b) enter inspect land reasonably believe killing capturing wild bird taken place request owner occupier land reasonably believe killing capturing wild bird taken place provide information about-- (i) (ii) number wild bird killed captured land mean wild bird killed captured (iii) poison may laid kill wild bird including without prejudice generality aforesaid quantity type information frequency laying poison enforcement

title: “authorised person” means a person appointed in accordance with Regulation
heading: 7. (1) A person who—
text_raw:
7. (1) A person who— 

(a) 

(b) 

obstructs or interferes with an authorised person when they are 
exercising a power conferred by Regulation 6, or 

fails to comply with a request for information made under 
Regulation 6(b), 

commits an offence. 

(2) A person who commits an offence under paragraph (1) shall be liable, 

on summary conviction, to a class D fine. 

Proceedings under these Regulations
text_norm: 7 (1) person who-- (a) (b) obstructs interferes authorised person exercising power conferred regulation 6 fails comply request information made regulation 6(b) commits offence (2) person commits offence paragraph (1) shall liable summary conviction class fine proceeding regulation

title: “authorised person” means a person appointed in accordance with Regulation
heading: 8. (1) Proceedings in relation to an offence under these Regulations may be
text_raw:
8. (1) Proceedings in relation to an offence under these Regulations may be 

brought and prosecuted by the Minister. 

(2) Summary proceedings for an offence under these Regulations may be 
brought and prosecuted by a person who is neither the Minister nor a member 
of the Garda Síochána with the consent— 

(a) 

(b) 

of the Minister, or 

an officer of the Minister, not below the rank of Assistant 
Secretary, nominated by the Minister for that purpose. 

Revocation and Savings
text_norm: 8 (1) proceeding relation offence regulation may brought prosecuted minister (2) summary proceeding offence regulation may brought prosecuted person neither minister member garda siochana consent-- (a) (b) minister officer minister rank assistant secretary nominated minister purpose revocation saving

title: “authorised person” means a person appointed in accordance with Regulation
heading: 9. (1) The Regulations of 1986 are revoked.
text_raw:
9. (1) The Regulations of 1986 are revoked. 

(2) Notwithstanding paragraph (1), where any criminal proceedings for an 

offence under the Regulations of 1986— 

 
 
 
 
 [576] 5 

(a) were pending immediately before the coming into operation of 

these Regulations, or 

(b) 

could have been prosecuted under the Regulations of 1986 
before the coming into operation of these Regulations, 

the proceedings may be prosecuted and disposed of, or may be brought, 
prosecuted and disposed of, under the Regulations revoked by paragraph (1) as 
if those Regulations were not so revoked. 

(3) Any declaration made by the Minister under Regulation 3(1) of the 
Regulations of 1986, which was operative immediately before the coming into 
operation of these Regulations, shall continue to be operative on, and after, the 
coming into operation of these Regulations and shall be dealt with as if made 
under these Regulations. 

(4) A reference in any enactment to the Regulations revoked by paragraph 
(1) is, unless the context otherwise requires, to be construed and has effect as if 
the reference is a reference to these Regulations or the corresponding provision 
of these Regulations, as the case may be. 

 
 
 
 6 [576]

title: “authorised person” means a person appointed in accordance with Regulation
heading: SPECIES OF BIRD
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 1 

SPECIES OF BIRD 

Regulation 3(1) 

Carrion Crow 

Hooded (Grey) Crow 

Magpie 

Rook 

Jackdaw 

Starling 

Herring Gull 

Corvus cornix; 

Corvus corone; 

Pica pica; 

Corvus frugilegus 

Corvus monedula; 

Sturnus vulgaris; 

Larus argentatus; 

Greater Black-backed Gull 

Larus marinus; 

Lesser Black-backed Gull 

Larus fuscus; 

House Sparrow 

Passer domesticus; 

Pigeon and Dove including Wood Pigeon (Columba palumbus), Feral Pigeon 
(Feral Columba livia) and Collared Dove (Streptopelia decaocto), but not 
including Carrier Pigeon, Fan Tailed Pigeon, Homing Pigeon or other domestic 
types of Rock Dove, Stock Dove (Columba oenas), Wild Rock Dove (Columba 
livia) or Turtle Dove (Streptopelia turtur); 

Any species of wild bird where a declaration under Regulation 3 is made in the 
interests of air safety. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 SCHEDULE 2 

[576] 7 

Regulation 3(2)(b) 

MEANS, ARRANGEMENTS OR METHODS OF CAPTURE OR KILLING

title: “authorised person” means a person appointed in accordance with Regulation
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations revoke and replace the European Communities (Wildlife 
Act 1976) (Amendment) Regulations 1986 (S.I. No 254 of 1986) which 
regulated the control of wild birds in certain circumstances. These Regulations 
were made in order to transpose Article 9 of the Birds Directive (Directive 
2009/147/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 30 November 
2009 on the conservation of wild birds, as amended). 

These Regulations empower the Minister for Housing, Local Government and 
Heritage (having consulted other relevant Ministers (if any)) to declare, where 
there is no other satisfactory solution and for reasons set out in Article 9 of the 
Directive, that specimens of particular species of wild bird may be captured or 
killed by specified means, arrangements or methods. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [576] 9
